Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, friendly, great position”
Reviews.Author: cycleaddict
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on a weekend deal and were very impressed. I asked for a high floor room before arrival and they obliged and as I'd read a couple of comments that the rooms were cold I asked for an extra blanket on our first night as it was very cold outside. This was delivered to our room immediately - but I didn't need it, the room temperature was perfect. The bathroom was small but new and spotless and the bed hard, but that's how I like a mattress to be. We slept really well. The other positive is the location. It's 10 min walk (or a tram opposite) to Alexanderplatz and 5 mins on the way is the Hofbrauhaus of Munich if you fancy a bit of oompa music! 10 mins uphill in the opposite direction, if you turn left around Knackstrasse area there's some lovely cafe bars and restaurants and we found a wonderful restaurant we ate in twice (Endlos) - big portions, good choice of food and very, very tasty. Great value. I'd happily recommend the Ibis Mitte if you're planning on being out and about in Berlin as you can walk to all the main historical sights.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: marce_313
Reviews.Content: Very plain and simple but clean and tidy. 10 Euro extra per person for breakfast seemed quite expensive, but breakfast buffet very good. Great location, only 10 minutes walk to Alexanderplatz (or one tram stop).

Reviews.Title: “A good budget choice, well located and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Blackheathbloke
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights recently, as part of a large group of lads in Berlin for a stag weekend. (There were 2 other stag parties there, and we were by far the best behaved!) Arrived on a Friday afternoon at about 4pm and check-in was quick and painless (most of the stag party arrived 2 hours after us so we missed the crowds). The room is fairly typical IBIS, nice and clean, small flat screen tv with a selection of channels (not sure which ones as I didn't switch it on) and the usual compact bathroom suite with shower. Wifi in the room is paid for but there is free wi-fi in reception and bar area, along with 2 PC's that are free to use. The location is quite good, being just up the hill from Alexandersplatz and all the transport links (there is a tram stop just outside) and also a short walk from the Hofbrau for some Bavarian hospitality. I didn't try the breakfast as I was never up in time (served until 11am at weekends) but did use the bar for drinks throughout the day and it was quite reasonably priced. Overall I'd come back and stay again, perfectly adequate hotel and if you know IBIS you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin..pre-wedding... trip”
Reviews.Author: Gellom
Reviews.Content: Came here with 10 other lads on my "pre wedding" trip..ok it was my stag do. But I can not praise the place enough. . The hotel itself is pretty standard Ibis fair, small clean and comfortable exactly what you need for a 2/3 day trip, it was the staff who made this a five star review, They were unbelieveably helpful from the moment we checked in us all (with good humour and little fuss, especially the tall guy on reception. I wish I could remember his name as I would be reporting him for going above and beyond all weekend.) to the day we left. Always pleased to see us and asking how the trip was going. Warning us about a tube strike and advising places to go. ( Fantastic beer hall just down the road on the left, keep an eye for it or you might jist walk past it!) Great little hotel... and the 24 hr bar was a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for Christmas markets”
Reviews.Author: Holidayhastings
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for Berlin's Christmas markets, easy walking distance to Alexanderplatz (an main transport hub) markets and slightly longer to Brandenburger Gate, Unter den Linden and other markets. Friendly, good standard budget hotel. Returning this year with friends - all over 65.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, basic clean room, BEST breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: TiffTiph
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for two nights on the last minute Wednesday Weekend Deals. We got the room for 81euro for the two nights which was fantastic!!! It was a simple clean hotel and room. We had two single beds and that was great. The bathroom was a little small but did the job fine. The hot water and water pressure was awesome, especially since it was so cold outside! It's a little walk from Alexanderplatz station, easy to find and easy to walk there, this was only a problem at night when it was really cold (we're Aussies though). Free wifi is in the lobby, but you have to pay to get it in the room, we didn't end up doing that, I guess considering how cheap the room was this is expected. The staff were always friendly and helpful. Breakfast was amazing! It was 10euro per person but totally worth it. I loved it as they had smoked salmon and lots of fresh salads and hams, very filling and light - I'm not much of a pastry/sweet breakfast person. My friend loved the cereal with chocolate in it (I didn't try it) and large selection of pastries. A coffee machine with cream, juice machine, champagne, sparkling water...everything! Best hotel breakfast I've ever had! The only negative thing that happened was on the day of our checkout we had to get up quite early and noticed the power was out, I'm not sure what happened but after about 20mins it randomly came back on. It might've been something with the snow/cold as it was insanely cold the weekend we were there. It was a bit of a pain but these things happen and it was at about 5am so probably wouldn't have noticed usually.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rooms, 20 minute walk from main stations.”
Reviews.Author: Mick H
Reviews.Content: Clean, generally reasonably priced, bit of a walk from stations.€10 for basic breakfast. Helpful staff. Would return. Went on a stag weekend, would take my woman next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay and visit Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MasterFan11
Reviews.Content: I have been there with my friends for 3 days. It is superb hotel for young people who wants to visit Berlin. It is in very good location and the price for this place is very fair. On the ground floor is a nice bar where you can eat some delicious snacks and drinks a lot of good things. The staff were really helpful. Rooms are pretty clean and quite big and modern.

Reviews.Title: “basic economy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ibrahimdesign
Reviews.Content: I live in Berlin just around the corner from the Ibis Hotel. The heating and hot water in my building failed last week, and I was freezing, so I decided to stay at the Ibis for a night. The staff was extremely helpful and kind. The room was very simple (and the decor was a bit sterile), but clean and warm. The bathroom was small but the shower worked very well and I definitely enjoyed a long hot shower. The beds are a bit hard (which I like) but the sheets were rather rough and I would have appreciated an extra duvet. Still, for the price, the hotel was a life-saver and very convenient for me to get back to my apartment to see if the heating was working, and to get to work. It's just outside a tram stop (although the windows are sound proofed and you don't hear it) and two blocks away from the U2 Senefelderplatz. I did not have the breakfast downstairs, as I went to work early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Compared with Intercity or Tryp hotels, Ibis Mitte is not good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite far from the nearest train stop, it's only a 7 min walk, but it's not as well located as it seems, the tramway stops right in front of it though. The beds were not the most comfortable ones we stayed in in our 3 week trip around Germany. Staff can be either really helpful (my husband had a headache and they were really understanding and helpful) or openly rude, depends on your luck. There is no kettle in the room. Internet is slow in the one computer at the lobby (it's free though) The hotel should at least give breakfast or parking for free to compensate for the little inconveniences. Compared with Intercity or Tryp hotels, Ibis does not give good value for money, at least at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to promise.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ibis stated "Problem to be solved within 15mins, else be the guest". I am shock to know their solution to the problem is "Simply No". I checked with the receptionist on the possible Christmas Market other then the one located at the Alexanderplatz and his quick reply was "Others are closed", which was not true. There was another and bigger Christmas market at Gendarmenmarkt. Showering during my stay was one of the last thing which I would do during my stay. The door of the toilet is poorly design where it allows cold air blowing in. The shower gel was not refill even its left with about 5%. Its enough for us but its just look unprofessional. This happened to my Frankurt stay too.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Red_Roket Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and thought the hotel was average. The location was close to Alexanderplatz and if you want to be in the heart of "tourist central" and don't want to spend too much money then the hotel is fine. In hindsight I should have researched Berlin more and stayed in another area. The room itself was good in size but we had issues with the heating and it was freezing. They did give us a heater to put in the room but this was useless in the middle of winter. The bed was really hard and my partner slept badly due to this. We had breakfast on one of the days and it was average.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: lady_muckfish
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to Alexanderplatz and within walking distance to many of the sites. Generally good service, one of the staff was quite eccentric demanding you try to speak German which we obliged, but it gets quite intimidating when he replies in a barrage of fast German back! Also was quite short in his way of trying to teach us the German custom. However the other stuff were friendly. Thought breakfast was quite overpriced at 10 Euros so we didn't bother, especially when you can just grab yourselves some croissants at the petrol station next door anyway! Double bed was 2 single mattresses put together which is quite annoying as they move about really easily so you end up with a massive gap in the middle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: PatrickCA15
Reviews.Content: This is a newer hotel (compared to other Ibis) that we've stayed at. The hotel is very clean & comfortable as expected. Free wifi is available in the lobby. The breakfast buffet for €10 per person was good as it includes fresh croissants, break, fruits, yogurt, cereal, boiled & scrambled eggs. However, it does get mundane after a couple of days. The hotel is located within a 10 minute walk of Alexander Platz, so it is very convenient & close to major attractions. The staff again are very friendly & courteous! Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Average, basic hotel. No frills but ok and very good location.”
Reviews.Author: michellesooty
Reviews.Content: we chose the Ibis, Berlin Mitte because of it´s location and boy was it a brilliant location. We stayed 3 nights, and arrived on Christmas Eve. Staff were generally friendly but I would guess some were a little stressed because they were working over the Xmas period (understandable). Discovered on Christmas Day night that our room, 518, was directly opposite a ´club´. If your looking for an early night on that day of the year be aware that your sleep might be ínterupted´ which some banging techno beats, and a few loud stragglers leaving intermittently throughout the night until 7am in the morning. Ask for a room at the back of the hotel instead, if you don´t want this. Generally I would stay here again, and location is wonderful, very close to Alexplatz and Kollwitz Platz for some nice restaurants and bars....

Reviews.Title: “Berlin before Xmas”
Reviews.Author: SW17LondonPaul Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Another welcome return to the Ibis Mitte. Always reliable, my 5th visit now. Perfectly placed to explore the "new" Berlin on borders of Mitte and Prenzlauer Berg. Excellent transport links via M2 tram line (2 mins walk from hotel) and only two stops to Alexanderplatz, a major transport hub with 3 metro lines, several suburban and regional lines. TXL airport bus to/from Tegel terminates at Alexanderplatz. Also good for new Berlin Brandenburg International Airport (currently Schoenefeld) with Airport Express service. Only 10-15 minutes walk from hotel to the heart of Prenzlauer Berg around Kollwitzplatz with great independent shops, restaurants and market. Hotel staff are always very helpful and efficient. This is one of the best Ibis hotels in the chain that I stay in. Hotel was having a refurbishment of breakfast area at the time of my stay, but with typical German efficiency, everything ran as well as usual, thanks to the staff. I will be back again soon! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Spot on, decent stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location. About a Five to ten mins walk from Alexanderplatz area and station. generally well located within the city. Staff were friendly , Clean rooms, etc although i did get a knock on the door teice from staff who didnt know any english who were looking to know about laundry or whatever i dont know as i dont speak german

Reviews.Title: “Receptionist lady on Friday 16.12 was really unpolite”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were really suprised how unpolite the lady in the reception was when we arrived on Friday evening. This is sad, as the hotel otherwise was very nice. We asked her about some advice related to nearby restaurants and she was rude and negative and arrogant

Reviews.Title: “Nice 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, near Alexanderplatz, tram stop outside the hotel. Room clean and spacious compared to other Ibis hotels. Breakfast a little expensive, with limited hot choices and not a lot of room due to renovation in breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Saytisfied and next time again with the IBIS”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied and next time I will stay again in the Ibis Mitte. Perfect location and reasonable price are attractive combination. One only proposal - I have litle troubles not havin a shoehorn and noone was in the room. Such small items and can help much for the visitor comfort.

Reviews.Title: “dec 2011 in berlin”
Reviews.Author: ChrysaB Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ibis mitte is located in the centre of berlin(close to alexandreplatz-walking distance). Clean hotel,my room had a view on tv tower and could be recommended for anyone who wants a cheap,basic accomadation.

Reviews.Title: “the wonderful Berlin Christmas markets”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a wonderful four day trip to Berlin for the Christmas markets which were fantastic. We were staying near Alexandraplax which has everything you need to make a great holiday. The beer keller was a good night out and exploring Berlin with the three day travel and museum pass made things so easy. The food was great and the hotel all that was required. We find Ibis hotels suit us very well in all parts of Europe and the UK

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location in Prenzlauer Berg”
Reviews.Author: sigulda158
Reviews.Content: This is a standard Ibis. There is free wifi in the rooms and a computer and printer in the lobby which you can use for free. Only a five minute walk from many restaurants. There is also a laundromat a five minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Berlino d'inverno”
Reviews.Author: Michelangelo V Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 night in this hotel. it is clean, the room is in the standard IBIS that means nice. The position is about 10 minutes walking from Alexander Place were you can find all public connection you need. We only slept in the hotel spending all the day out looking at the city. Finally I suggest this hotel. Pay attention on it if you want to stay some day more during the weekend, book separatly the weekend as a special offer and than the other days.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Berlin”
Reviews.Author: GREEKSTORYTELLER
Reviews.Content: A pleasant stay,close to Alexanderplatz,rooms clean and with a beautiful view,breakfast normal,prices attractive,pure suggestion to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: bpbright Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for the money and very close to Alexanderplatz. The only issue was that the bed was rather hard. The bed was really big though. The staff were extremely helpful, friendly and efficient. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel early and had a great rate - €49 per room per night. The location was handy to Alexander Platz and the lovely Prenzlauer Berg district. The room and bathroom were very clean, and staff friendly. Very good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and convenient stay in Berlin Prenzlauerberg”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_NL030
Reviews.Content: The IBIS Hotel Berlin Mitte is conveniently located at 10 minutes walking of the Alexanderplatz and 5 minutes from the Senefelderplatz. Friendly staff, clean room. Not very big, but it has all you need. The bed was very nice and the matress was pretty hard, just as I like it. Breakfast is good, only 10 Euro, but it can be a bit crowded around 09:00, but I must say there was always sufficient place and the staff was very quick in supplying the food to the buffet. Alltogether a good hotel close to the main U- and S-Bahnen and Bus TXL brings you directly from Alexanderplatz to Tegel Airport. The next time we will definetely stay here again. Tips: 1. If you want to go to the gym/fitness: there is a gym opposite to the hotel where you can have a free 3 (?) day trial membership 2. The gas station near the hotel has a 24/7 convenience store

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Berlin”
Reviews.Author: sgreenbhoy
Reviews.Content: Good for location but poor on service. Easy walk to transport both tram and train. Bar staff very rude and inattentive Go to Henrys bar, turn right and walk about 800m, fantastic place and he cares for his customers Car park way too expensive but helped by the hourly reductons in the price of diesel at the petrol station, well hourly until the day we left!! Easy to find by car with a decent sat nav

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic but a Clean and tidy Hotel in heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: HappyMoonChild
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight in this hotel with my freind and it was centerally located and few bus stop to all Berlin attractions. The bus stop is just in front of the hotel and very easy to use and access to other places. you can also have a 15-20 minutes walk to reach the Berliner Dome and all other attractions. The Hotel looks very clean, tidy but simple.our room was very basic but had a great view. We also bought two walking tours from Hotels desk which was very intresting. we visited all the famous attractions in 2 hours walking with 10 other peoples and a very nice guld with a fluent english. this Hotel is full of young people and inexpensive with acceptable service standards and in general good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough and very close to the conference centre”
Reviews.Author: Environs74
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights recently and was attending a conference at the ICC. It is very convenient for this and is an excellent choice if being close is what you want. The hotel itself is comfortable and clean. The staff were friendly and spoke good English. The free WIFI is only available in certain areas. I had a business package which included WIFI in my room, but otherwise I would have had to pay for it. The breakfast buffet is what you would expect - perfectly acceptable but nothing extraordinary. The bar is open all day/ night and has a very limited snack menu with small portions. There is a 'restaurant' attached but it is only a snack bar which is actually attached to the coach station next door. Sky News is available on TV in the room (channel 55). The travel links are good with the S and U bahn stations very close (although a little confusing!). Overall I would recommend if attending a conference or arriving/ leaving from the coach station and want a close hotel overnight. Othewise I would head more central.

Reviews.Title: “Please use internet - but pay for it if used in the room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It might be convenient if the internet is available in the room for no extra cost. If we had not asked if internet was available we would be charged for having used the PC in the room. But we were told about a free access to the internet in the reception area. We just felt it was a kind of coincidence that we got this information. We would like to have access to a News channel. ex. CNN or BBC World.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly priced hotel for the budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall OK stay. Only problem was the cigarette smoke smell, despite having stayed there for 3 nights, remained in the room. The shower/shampoo was never replaced despite it being empty for 2 days! I had to inform front desk for it to have it replaced. I am wondering what housekeeping was up to!

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: SirIsaacNewton
Reviews.Content: Very good location for exploring the Mitte and Pretzlauer. Bog standard chain hotel. Clean and pleasant room. Okay breakfast. Minor irritations: no coffee making facilities in the rooms, EXPENSIVE internet access in the rooms although a couple of free terminals and free wireless in the lobby (so why not in the rooms!?). Lots of TV channels - but it would be nice to have something in English other than just news to watch! Would be fine for a couple of nights but if you're trying to go cheap for a longer stay I'd recommend trying to go self-catering in one of Berlin's many apartment type hotels.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: Lublasi303605
Reviews.Content: Ibis is always my choice when I can find one with a good location. You can't go wrong with Ibis, rooms were clean, bathroom as well, the only bad thing is that they don't have any friges in the rooms. However, location was really good, we went walking to most attractions and in case we had to go to a far attraction, it was really easy to get to U-bahn.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: coachmark
Reviews.Content: First time in Berlin. Hotel is in a good location very near the M2 tram stop which takes you into the main square which is only a few minutes way. Clean functional rooms very similar to the Holiday Inn Express product which I prefer. Buffet breakfast was good. Some strafe appeared to be a little rude and impatient but maybe that's a cultural thing? Free wifi only in the lounge and bar areas. You have to pay for room access internet. In summary a good 2 star hotel offering 2 star service.

Reviews.Title: “3 nights at IBIS Berlin Mitte”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: ACCOR hotels have many properties in Berlin. I chose this one above the others due to its location (not a long walk from Alexanderplatz, 10 minutes only) and it's rates (about midway amongst the options available). If you want something different then you don't stay at an IBIS hotel. They are all pretty much identical, though some are better staffed/cleaner/more organised than others. I was not disappointed with this one. The staff were helpful, all spoke good English, and the hotel itself is clean, tidy and well-run. Also, the restaurant was better organised than other IBIS hotels I have stayed in, where you often find shortages of plates, knives, spoons, and even some the of the food items - I had almost come to accept this as standard in an IBIS hotel. There is often an air of chaos at breakfast. However, thankfully that was not the case with this particular IBIS hotel. I would happily stay there again when next heading back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “trip to berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was on vacation to berlin with a friend when I stayed at the ibis hotel. We wanted a value hotel but better quality then what a hostel could provide. We found the ibis hotel on the internet and decided to stay their. The ibis hotel was clean and the breakfast was very good. The facilitys were good except for the matress which was to hard. The service as far as cleaning the room was good but the front desk was so so. My freind and I only speak english so some mis comuication is completly understandable but the staff was somewhat rude. We wanted to split the bill between the two of us, and the person at the front desk said she did'nt understand and was rude. I also think the hotel was slitly overpriced. I think if the hotel staff was nicer, the mattres was softer and the price was 15 dollars left a night I would give a completly diffrent rating. On a postive note the breakfast was deliciouse. but also expensive at 10 euros a person.

Reviews.Title: “ibis hotel berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel was in a great location. we were given a smoking room on arrival and asked to be changed, which initially did not seem possible but reception went out of their way to find us a non smoking room which was very lovely and quiet. I would stay with you again for sure

Reviews.Title: “First impression matters”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I thought the general service/ cleanliness/ location/value for money was fine . However when you have traveled a long way and when you check in and out , you would expect the staff at the reception to be a little bit more welcoming, I felt that I was disturbing the brune girl at the reception and testing her patience ( if she is not happy with her job condition, who is forcing her to be there? I felt) she was also at the reception ( putting her and reception in the same sentence is a bit pushing the boundary) and she advises me wrongly as to the train I had to take to the Airport ... Shouldn't she know better? the other staff were fine and helpful ..

Reviews.Title: “Good location for weekend in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location was good - close to Alexanderplatz with S-bahn, U-bahn and the end station with the flight bus for Tegel departing every 10th minutes. Really good breakfast! Would have preferred a non smoking room - maybe it was a boking possibility? Good value in total.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for a good price”
Reviews.Author: DummyBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a couple of days. The rooms (we had twin rooms) were modern, quiet and clean. They had a shower. The beds and mattresses were quite comfortable. The rooms were furnished with a chair and a TV (we could find a few French and English channels). We found the staff at the reception (especially at night) very helpful and friendly and they spoke good English. There was a small snack/bar open 24 a day: enjoying a cold Pilsner after walking and visiting things all the day through Berlin is quite enjoyable - the price was the same as what we paid in the other bars we went to. There are 2 tram stations within a 5min walk from the hotel and you can reach Alexanderplatz (a major transportation hub in Berlin) either by walking 15min or with the tram in 2 stops. The hotel also sells postcards, stamps, welcomcard (for transportations) and has several ads/vouchers for Berlin attractions. To summarize: we were very satisfied for the price-quality ratio (we paid ~60EUR/night with no special offer) and we would definitely go there again. Now for the small glitches: - we had no free wifi in our room. - The rack price tag for the breakfast was a bit expensive (~10EUR/person) so we skipped it and ate around Alexanderplatz.

Reviews.Title: “The best Ibis Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: PiwoDortmund
Reviews.Content: Don't expect a great service when you stay at Ibis. However, this Ibis hotel is quite modern and the location is very good. The famous TV tower is just a few minutes away and public transport is round the corner.A disadvantage is parking because in the underground garage the parking fee is € 10,00 per day. During daytime parking behind the hotel is €1,00 per hour. The breakfast is simple, but sufficient. I do not recommend the bar of the hotel because the variety of the food is very limited.

Reviews.Title: “wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The "wi-fi" in the bedrooms should be free. The breakfast should be untill 11h. It would be good if had a freezer on the bedrooms. .

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location a short walk from Alexanderplatz - perfect for sightseeing and access to airports. Pleasant room and very quiet. Store just outside the hotel perfect for stocking up on snacks and other provisions.

Reviews.Title: “The quality and consistency you can expect from an Ibis.”
Reviews.Author: bp83
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days in May for a business trip. I needed to stay somewhere that was easily accessible, inexpensive and wasn't going to be awful. I've stayed in many Ibis hotels all over the world so was certain this would be a reasonable bet. The hotel is in a building that looks mid-90's in construction. There is a large petrol station at the front of the hotel with a shop (handy!) and the hotel entrance is to the side. Inside the hotel reception is what you would expect of an Ibis, and the bar is to the rear. There is a 'business centre' with PC's and printers and free wifi. I stayed in room 218, which was overlooking the road. A bit noisy with the window open and the constant bell from the lift, but nothing too disruptive. There is air conditioning in the rooms if the noise is too much to have the window open. The room is decorated in the older style of Ibis rooms - a pale green and pine theme. The bed was two singles pushed together, but travelling alone meant that this was fine. As in every Ibis I have been to, the room was extremely clean and had everything I needed. As mentioned in the other reviews, the bed was a bit hard but I think this is just a personal preference. Breakfast is served on the first floor overlooking the petrol station forecourt (!). It is the usual Ibis buffet and is best described as continental with lots of choice. The room is large and the staff are helpful. The reception staff were friendly and fluent in English, despite my attempts at German. The hotel looks a little tired in places and could benefit from some updating. I think that anyone staying in this Ibis though is given a clear impression of the standard from the website etc. so this should not be a surprise. For me the worst feature of the hotel is the location - walking from Alexanderplatz to the hotel means passing lots of other hotels that are all in a slightly better place. The Ibis is not in a bad location, but unless you want to take the tram everywhere there is a walk of about 15 minutes involved in getting to most places. Given the opportunity I would stay in this hotel again if I needed to. If you are looking for a budget hotel that is a cut above a hostel or B&B then head to Ibis.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: WorldFuneral
Reviews.Content: If you've ever stayed at an Ibis before, then you'll probably have a fair idea of what this hotel is like. I have stayed in various Ibis hotels in various countries, and so far my experience is that they've always managed to maintain the same standards throughout. A bit boring maybe, but the reliability of the brand takes some of the stress out of organising a trip. Ibis Berlin Mitte is a nice budget hotel, situated quite centrally in the east of the city. It's not smack-bang in the centre, but it's central enough for easy access, and benefits from being located in a quiet area away from all the tourists and noise. The staff were very professional and helpful throughout. We had a double room which was compact but big enough for our needs. The bed wasn't the most comfortable I've ever slept in and it was very hot during the night (and our window was jammed shut!) but these are minor gripes. I would certainly recommend this hotel as a good base for seeing Berlin on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value - Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChefDemonios Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located and we even walked from the train station! The staff was more than helpful and the hotel was so very comfortable and peaceful. We enjoyed the breakfast more than we have enjoyed it in any other Ibis hotel. We cannot say enough good things about this hotel and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price - but very basic”
Reviews.Author: Maren-Maus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ibis for 4 nights - and can only agree that the beds are horribly hard. It makes you have backpain. In general the rooms are clean - but very basic - it reminded me a bit of a better youth hostel. The service at reception was average to poor. The staff was often unfriendly. Very good was the breakfast buffet! Lots of choice and good quality! And the location as it is very clos to Alexanderplatz. Value for money: yes. Cosy & Comfy: no

Reviews.Title: “Prima location, also for Berlin Halbmarathon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Thanks for the good service, paying special attention to the many Berlin Halbmathon runners in the hotel on the night 02-03 Mach (lots of banans, etc.). Late check out allowed enough time for a shower afterteh race.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Situated not far from Rosa Luxembourg Platz and Alexander Platz in East Berlin. Easy to get to the city centre by tram or metro (U-bahn). The service level was good, over all good value for money! The room was surprisingly quiet during night time. Clean standard Ibis rooms and snacks and drinks available 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time in Ibis Berlin Mite”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Last Year I was in the same Hotel and This year I decide to stay in the same one. Actually I am pretty satisfied with whole wide range of Accor Hotels and I always intent to choose Accor Hotel if is available in trip destination.

Reviews.Title: “Good night Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent friendly check-in staff who spoke good English and helped with good suggestions about local restaurants. My only complaint is that there is no restaurant or coffee shop. There is a good room service menu but why can't thye use the extensive breakfast room as a restaurant at night?

Reviews.Title: “Beds as hard as rock”
Reviews.Author: carpediem111 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located about 10 minutes walk from Alexanderplatz. The hotel is getting slightly dated, although the rooms were very clean. Certainly a two star property, which is how it is advertised. Service at reception was ok and breakfast also ok, but not the best we've had at an Ibis. The biggest problem for us was the bed. Previous reviews had warned that the beds were "firm"...this is an understatment! Both nights we had terrible sleeps due to the too hard matresses. Really like sleeping on the floor!

Reviews.Title: “Rudely surprised with 40 Euros of extra cost at checkout.”
Reviews.Author: philstjohn
Reviews.Content: I paid nearly $100 Euros/night. I thought the value was ok, because the rooms were clean. But they were not well stocked - 1 small towel, no washcloth, no soap, no shampoo. Hair dryer shut off after 2 minutes of use. You can't leave the room without shutting off all the electricty in the room because the door key card is required to engage the electricty. The breakfast was good. The lady at the front desk (and another on the phone when I made the reservation), said breakfast was included, so I didn't mind paying a little more than average. But when I checked out 4 days later the desk clerk said, "Breakfast is not included". He just kept repeating the same thing when I told him what I had been told, he would not fetch the manager and we had to catch a train so I paid the 40 Euros! But I won't be back there!

Reviews.Title: “BEST LOCATION FOR BERLIN”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located just near Alexander Platz, you can reach the heart of the city both by walking or by the tram very easıly.Also its very easy to reach from the TEGEL Airport to the hotel.Tthe hotel room was comfortable and clean but as we stayed on the seventh floor it was a little bit cold so we wanted a electirical heater.The staff was helpful and kind. There was a free internet, the price for five nights was cheap for Berlin. We recommend this hotel for everyone who decides to stay in Berlin for long days.Thanks a lot to the Accor hotel group. R&B

Reviews.Title: “Visit to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Short visit to Berlin to get visa to Kazakhstan. Absolute OK hotel. Centrally placed for various touristic activities as well. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “nice and silent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and warm. Secvice in the bar was very good. Room was silent and only problem was the weather (too much snow).

Reviews.Title: “Anew-built, nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: max_uvarov
Reviews.Content: A 2-star hotel that can be rated as a well-done 4-star. Very clean, well-equipped, seems to have been reconstructed recently. Quiet surroundings - but easily acceptable - 5 minutes to Alexanderplatz. Rooms are quite spary, the second door makes you hear nothing from the outside. The staff answered all requests shortly and with a result. The venue is not suitable for romantic trips or all-comfort relaxations. But isn't it all about Berlin itself?:)

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: heimarkku Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel's location is pretty good near the Alexanderplatz and Berlin tv-tower. Room is clean and modern but the bed is hardest which I have found so far; in spite of it I slept well because the room was really silent (backyard side). There are no refrigerator/drinks in the room. The breakfast is really good and comprehensive but costs 10 € which is a little bit much for a breakfast. The internet is free in the lobby (only one computer!) and WiFi costs 9 €/24hr (it should nowadays be included into the room price!). I would still recommend this hotel and could use also during my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Quetzal1
Reviews.Content: We happened upon the Ibis while looking for decent, reasonably priced hotel on Sunday evening. The reception staff were extremely pleasant and helpful and check-in was a breeze. The room was amply sized and comfortable (although the bed was slightly too firm for my taste). The view of the Berlin radio tower and (and the Christmas fair) from the room was incredible! We bombarded the staff with lots of questions about getting around, sites to visit, etc., during our two-day stay, and they continued to be cheerful and helpful, even taking time to research ferry costs and schedules on the web. One staff member took time to look up the name and address of an area museum he had loved as a child, thinking that our four-year-old son would enjoy it, too. Hopefully, we'll make it back to Berlin in the near future and, if we do, we'll definitely check out the Ibis again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed one week on November 2010. Standard Ibis quality which you can always trust. Even though hotels computer was out of order when I checked in everything went along well. Possible to choice the view to the city or quiet room, I chose the view. There wasn´t much noice on that side either, some caused by traffic but it didn´t disturb me. Staff was friedly and helpfull. Good breakfast. Quite well located, 2 tram stops from Alexanderplatz where plenty of transportation choices, e.g. TXL bus to Tegel airport. Lots of restaurants aroud Alexanderplatz and Hackesher Markt. Very good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel slightly outdated”
Reviews.Author: chear_up
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Ibis Mitte for a couple of nights on a weekend break in Berlin. It is a good quality hotel, clean good size rooms and ok location. The styling of the rooms is slightly outdated but still ok for budget hotel. It is located slightly too far to be comfortable walking to the city centre, so best to take a tube. The tube station is approximately 10 minutes walk from the hotel, the area is not very pleasant though for walking in the night time.

Reviews.Title: “IBIS Berlin Mitte - Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for visiting the principal sites in the city, within walking distance of Museum Island, Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, Jewish Museum, Holocaust Memorial and the Reichstag. Convenient for the main inter-city railway station - 10 Euro taxi ride. Close to Alexanderplatz Station for the metro system. Close to Prenz-Lauer with a great range of restaurants and design led shopping within a ten minute walk. Only drawback was the absence of any English language television channel - no BBC World News.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value - you can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: MeanduEssex
Reviews.Content: The price attracted us to this hotel and we were not disappointed. The rooms were average sized, but spotless and functional. Our room was at the back of hotel and very quiet. The bed was a large kingsize and firm. Did not use the airconditioning as opening windows was sufficient for October. The TV only had CNBC, Eurosport and MTV as English speaking channels, but there was also one English radio channel. The bathroom had a great shower, average sized but with a good spray and very clean. The staff were wonderful. We asked for extra pillows and towels and got these within 10 minutes. There is a cafe in the hotel which we didn't use but next door to this hotel is a garage, where you can get soft drinks, beers and snacks, croissants etc which is handy for late snacks. The M2 tram is just across the road and will take you into Alexanderplatz (one stop) where there is a main interchange, from where you can get transport to most areas of Berlin. You could walk there in 10 mins. We took the overground train from Schonfeld Airport to Alexanderplatz and were at the hotel in 35 mins. We bought an all in one ticket from the helpful info desk at the airport to cover our transport costs. There is so much to see in Berlin it is hard to recommend places to visit, but in particular the Reichstag (get there early, we got there at 8.15 and went straight in, when we came out the queue was 90 mins long! The TV tower is worth a visit, also if you like museums we thought the best one was the Pergamon in Mitte, small but perfectly formed. If you like shops visit the Alexa Centre at the back of Alexanderplatz (a little hard to find), they have everything you could need there is about 200 shops in there and a miniature Berlin museum too on the top floor (something different). Finally, enjoy the pretzels and bratwursts with a beer wherever you can!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: big_ebbot
Reviews.Content: After having spend some time looking for hostels I found this hotel at a cheaper price. The hotel is, as all Ibis hotels, nothing special. The price is good, the location is good, the staff is very helpful. One computer in the lobby with free Internet. It was running WIndoze so it was frequently borked. Wifi cost quite a lot (coming from Sweden I'm used to this being free). I can recommend this hotel as a budget hotel to go crash at. I mean, after all, are you in Berlin for the hotel or the city???

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rplj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ibis Berlin Mitte (which, by the way, is located in Prenzlauer Berg, very close to, but not exactly Mitte) for 1 week in june 2010. Excelent value for money: polite staff, very good breakfest and a clean and comfortable room, more spacious than any other Ibis room I've seen. An unexpected plus was a nice window view of the Fernsehturm (Berlin TV Tower). However, it's a shame that Ibis still keeps pushing two single beds together as a double bed. It just doesn't work. The location is not five-star, but not bad also. There are department stores and restaurants near Alexanderplatz, less than 1Km away, easily reached by tram or by walking. Overall, I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Agree : two stars are not enough :)”
Reviews.Author: samspaceopera
Reviews.Content: Near Alexander Platz (8 minutes walk to this 'strategic' place). Rooms from 59€. Nice staff, nice rooms very clean, great beds, great breakfast. Near gas station, very handy for day and night shopping. Very good location in this neighbourhood of ex east Berlin area.

Reviews.Title: “Two Stars Are Not Enough”
Reviews.Author: Capricorn113
Reviews.Content: I had not stayed in an Ibis hotel previously, so I had no idea what to expect on arrival at the Berlin Mitte. What I found was excellent. The hotel is situated on the corner of Prenzlauer Berg and Prenzlauer Allee, conveniently next to a filling station. If you are arriving by car, this is the only place you can park until you arrange underground parking with the hotel. The staff on Reception were very friendly and helpful, especially when they realised that a mistake had been made with my booking. They sorted out the error calmly and efficiently and even offered me a coffee while I waited. They were also a fount of local knowledge and because of this I was able to provision my room from the local supermarket in a very few minutes after checking-in. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean and commanded a wonderful view of the Fernsehturm in Alexanderplatz. The shower was powerful and the bathroom well stocked with hair and body wash. The hairdryer worked well and plenty of towels were provided. The TV showed only German-language stations with the exception of France TV5 and Eurosport, although BBC World Service could be obtained on the radio channel. There were no drawers in the room; clothes had to stacked on six narrow shelves in the hallway. However, there were plenty of coathangers to hang items from. The airconditioning worked well, but only when the room was occupied and the key card inserted into the slot to activate the electrical supply. Since we were in a heatwave with temperatures of 30-35C, a little friendly pleading with the cleaner was required to obtain a spare card to plug in and thus ensure that the room remained cool. The bed was a double and had a summer-weight duvet. The mattress was more than firm and those travellers who like a softer bed might be advised to call the hotel in advance and ask if one might be provided. Breakfast is served on the First Floor and boasts a good variety of options with dishes to suit all tastes, although those who favour the full English 'death-on-a-plate' might feel disappointed. The coffee is excellent; tea drinkers might be advised to take their preferred bags with them. The Dining Room is light and airy, has an excellent view and newspapers are provided for free. The hotel bar is located behind Reception and is quite reasonably priced in comparison with other Berlin hotels. Opposite Reception is a lobby area with free internet access. Parking is in a underground garage which is accessed from Prenzlauer Berg on a card system; this can be a trifle tricky for drivers of right-hand-drive vehicles, so having a passenger is a bonus. Parking was charged at 10 Euros a day. The hotel is located just 10 minutes' walk from Alexanderplatz; if you don't fancy walking, there is a tram stop a couple of minutes' walk up Prenzlauer Allee. A tip when travelling around Berlin on public transport is to buy the Tageskarte which is valid for 24 hours and costs 6.10 Euros at time of writing. From Alexanderplatz, all public transport is accessible. The hotel is also located some 10 minutes' walk from Kollwitzplatz, which is where you will find lots of eateries, including the excellent 'Endlos', which specialises in Berlin cuisine. Overall, the Ibis Berlin Mitte punches well above its weight in terms of service, quality of stay and location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !!”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: This is the 1st time that I have ever stopped at an Ibis and was dubious due to it being a 2star !! However it exceeded my expectations to say the least !!! It was so clean and the beer in the hotel bar was the cheapest we found !! Would Certainly recommend it....but don't expect smiles and happiness off the staff as they were a right bunch of miserys, but that didn't bother us in the slightest !!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Ibis hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: lgsdias
Reviews.Content: My experience on Berlin Ibis Mitte was very good. I can easily state that this is the best Ibis facility I've been so far: nice breakfast, got a large clean room, efficient staff. Conveniently located at Berlin Mitte, walking distance to Alexanderplatz and TV Tower and has a Tram way right on the front avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gracie099
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel around 11ish in the morning and our room wasn't ready which was fine, as we were very early for the stated check in time. The receptionist allowed us to store our bags in a locked room and made a note of which ones were ours, which was good enough for us! We then had our first full day to explore Berlin! This hotel has an amazing location. which is its main advantage; 10 minutes walk to Alexanderplatz where you can get a straight train to the airport, and also 10 minutes to Mitte where there are lots of lovely restaurants and nightlife. We tended to turn right out of the hotel each evening however, and in to Prenzlauerberg, which the hotel receptionist kindly drew us a directions map for. Here, there were beautifully quaint cafes and restaurants with outdoor heaters and fairy lights! Beutiful in the faint misty, autumnal evenings! Be sure to take a trip to Hairy Mary's bar if you can-the owners are Glaswegian and American and really friendly! One of the best nights we have had on holiday so far! All in all, the rooms were basic, but clean, and for a city break what more can you ask for, as you spend your time exploring the city? Great value for money, fantastic location, and pleasant walk to nearby prenzlauerberg. Loved Berlin, can't wait to go back and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value for money”
Reviews.Author: signal38
Reviews.Content: I am always surprised by people who complain a 2* hotel doesn't feel like the raffles or the Crillon... but you get what you pay for - OK, sometimes you get less but in this case I think you get more. I guess it's all down to expectations and uses - *all* I expect from a hotel is a good night's sleep, without smells or noises. I don't care that much for room size, or even window view. OK, make it clean, this is important, but other than that, I'm all right. I'm there to sleep, and anything else I do elsewhere (which is why I can't comment on food, for instance - I always eat dinner out, and almost always breakfast, since I have only met very few hotel breakfasts I could like.) In this particular case, whether I was lucky or whether all rooms are the same, I can't say - but I think I got much more than what I paid for. The room was spacious, clean, the bed comfortable, and the view... well it was great. I could see the TV tower and the rest of the city. So, yes - the staff weren't the friendliest, nor the most efficient. And as with most Ibis there's only a ridiculous little PC with web access in the hall, for which you tend to have to wait for. But the location was truly wonderful - not ten minutes' walk from Alexanderplatz, and going the other way there were lots of very nice places to eat, drink, have coffee. For that money, those low-brow chain hotels make up in value what they, undoubtedly, so severely lack in charm (and boy, do they lack charm :)) I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: SilviaMadalina
Reviews.Content: From the very beginning, our experience in Ibis Berlin Mitte was unpleasant : - at the check-in time the receptionist did not greet us; - they didn't pay attention to our requests. - they couldn't help us with basic information about the surroundings of the hotel so we had to manage ourselves. - even we were told that the bar was opened 24 hours, the same receptionist, whom was assisting in the bar, told us that we have to pay and to consume as soon as possible because she wants to go home earlier; - we had to wait for more than 5 hours for them to bring us a sheet and when they finally did, it was a blanket and it was after 00.30 in the morning..... The request was made at 6 PM. Overall I could say that this was the worse experience that I had in one of the Accor Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Berlin Mitte”
Reviews.Author: EmilieV26
Reviews.Content: Greatest Ibis hotel I have been to, very clean and the staff is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean & awesome location...”
Reviews.Author: ScottSqu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights while in Berlin. Can not complain. Staff were friendly, breakfast as good, room was spotless and the location is perfect for tourists....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay in the Mitte area”
Reviews.Author: tshirtontour
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel. We found it excellent and well located. The hotel lobby was bright and welcoming. The reception staff were attentive and deal with check-in and check-outs without any fuss. We were allocated a room on the third floor overlooking the back of the hotel. Our room was designed for use by a person using a wheelchair so it meant we got a large spacious room. The room was bright and well laid out. The bathroom was spacious and the shower facilities were top class with lots of hot water. Housekeeping was efficient and kept the room spotless. Minor criticisms would be: only one chair in the room, at times the room get hot and stuffy as the air condition unit in the room had a mind of its own, lack of a tea/coffee making facility which we believe should be standard in a hotel room fitout. So for now bring your own kettle/cups etc. The large screen television has only three English language channels – one sport, one business and one news. View at 20/21/23. We did not avail of any meals at the hotel so we cannot comment on them. The hotel is located about ten minutes walk from Alexanderplatz. When you leave the hotel turn left and keep walking on the payment until you come to a railway flyover. Turn left here and you arrive at Alexanderplatz. It is a large paved square area surrounded by retail outlets and street vendors. Alexanderplatz railway station is also located here. This is large train station but very user friendly. There is a large amount of hot food outlets here so getting breakfast/lunch is easy enough to arrange. The area around the hotel is safe enough to walk at night but you can get a tram from Alexanderplatz (M2) which stops about three minutes down from the hotel entrance. From the hotel to the Brandenburg Gate is a one hour walk in a straight line which gives you overall of the area around Mitte. You can also take bus 100/200 which stops about two minutes walk to the Brandenburg Gate. If you find Alexanderplatz is a bit quiet take the 100 or 200 bus to the end of its route at the Zoo terminus. You are now in the Kurfurstendamm area which is lively retail area. Overall, IBIS Berlin Mitte hotel is a nice place to stay and we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive Hotel in East Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MisterWombat
Reviews.Content: The Ibis Berlin Mitte at Prenzlauer Allee 4 is about a kilometer from the Alexanderplatz railway station over rough cobblestone sidewalks. Exit the side of the station away from the TV tower, turn left and go to the main road (Prenzlauer Allee), then turn right and walk up the hill. No directional signs from the railway station to Ibis, which is unusual. Ibis is behind a Total gas station. Or take the M2 tram from the side of the railway station with McDonald's, opposite the TV tower and across from the Galerie shopping center, 2 stops. Get a Berlin City Tour Card at the railway station for how many days you will stay, good for all buses, trams, subways, trains and even to Potsdam if you buy a zone ABC ticket. Comfortable room reasonable in size with good desk space, plasma TV, small shower/toilet room but with some shelf space, no refrigerator, heat and air conditioning worked, window could be opened. Wireless internet works only on some floors, is 8 Euros per day, fairly slow, and can be used only in one continuous session. Log off and you cannot log back on. Also had viruses. One free internet computer in lobby, good speed and has an available USB port and CD/DVD reader. Maids will take all of your drink bottles unless you leave them a note not to.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient location”
Reviews.Author: RoverSWEngland
Reviews.Content: I have happily stayed at various Ibis two star hotels in Berlin and found the staff like all Berliners, to be friendly and helpful, nice clean rooms and more than adequate buffet breakfasts. Ibis Hotel Mitte like Ibis Hotel Messe are both close to the U2 line on the U-Bahn which conveniently connects many places of interest. I particularly like Hotel Ibis Mitte because it is conveniently situated close to Alexander Platz with the hustle and bustle but with many quieter spots close by. A Tram/Streetcar from outside the hotel reaches Alexander Platz in just one stop or the terminus at Alex' main line station in two stops I just hope I do not encourage too many people to stay there as I would like to know they have a room free when I wish to return

Reviews.Title: “Very good to visit the city”
Reviews.Author: mirtilla752000
Reviews.Content: Very clean, in the city center, good priece and with a very helpfull staff; do not have the breakfast at the hotel (it's too expensive) but have breakfast at the "bonjur" cafeteria just outside the hotel - wonderful cappuccinos and good pastries!

Reviews.Title: “very central”
Reviews.Author: Terence_Hill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 1 night. The great thing about this hotel is its location. It is just 2 stops away with the tram from Alexanderplatz (stop: Prenzlauer Allee/Mollstr.). The rooms are simple but clean. We got a good rate on the hotel website for EUR 49 the night.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Kath70
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with my husband from 26th - 30th Oct 2008. Very pleased with the location just 2 tram stops from Alexanderplatz from where you can get trains, buses and trams to every part of Berlin. Hotel was very clean, reasonable size room, very comfortable bed and excellent continental breakfast for 9.50. Staff friendly and gave advice on transport, sights to see etc. Just one quibble! only one towel provided per person and this a smallish bath towel which I was told was the standard in Ibis hotels? However when I queried this there was no problem getting extra towels ( though the maid removed these and only left 2 fresh ones the next day!} Berlin is so easy to get around. The Berlin Card is well worth getting as it gives 3 days of travel on buses, trams, trains underground etc plus discounts to all museums etc. The bus lines 100 and 200 are excellent as they travel through all the tourist attractons in the city. Would be happy to stay in this hotel again because of the price and the excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice”
Reviews.Author: KONTRYWY
Reviews.Content: The room is really small, the tv simply didn`t work, people from the front desk and the restaurant are rude, because they think they speak english well and they don`t like to repeat answers, however, their accents are terrible, sounds like "eating rocks while talking..."

Reviews.Title: “Corporate, Clean, Comfortable, Courteous....”
Reviews.Author: Scubatwo
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Ibis in Mitte probably 5 or so times over the past 8 years, as it's in a beautifully convenient location as far as we're concerned. For those of us flying in on a 'cheap flight' to Schonefeld, you get straight onto the Regionalzug at the railway station at the airport and get off at Alexanderplatz. The Ibis is on Prenzlauer Allee and takes about 10 minutes to reach if you're reasonably healthy. If you can't face the walk, use the tram - there are tram stops in the road opposite the hotel which means that you have good links to other parts of the city. You can always use the tram to get to the nearest U or S-bahn if you need to, or simply don't fancy a long walk anywhere. The Ibis is not particularly cheap, but the rooms are clean, spacious, and comfortable. They are well soundproofed, which is just as well as the road is busy 24/7. The breakfasts are not included in the price, but if you opt to take them you can really fill up from the wide ranging buffet provided. I noticed that a previous reviewer had said you can't do anything about the view of the factory - the first time we stayed this was derelict and there was a squatters party going on in the roof area. The factory has now been converted to a gym and business complex as the whole of Prenzlauer is becoming a bit of a yuppy paradise. And as for seeing Alexanderplatz - that's the whole point of staying in this area of the city!! You can't miss the TV Tower from the hotel if your room looks downhill, and it's a great reminder of the old East. The staff are really helpful - we've asked them about various bus times and how easy it is to get to places etc and they have always offered assistance. At the end of the day, Ibis are an international chain and you're paying for what you get. This isn't always a bad thing, because if you've used the Ibis or similar elsewhere, you have an idea what to expect. Book the hotel, check in, and relax.

Reviews.Title: “clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: YXEinWAW
Reviews.Content: A group of us spent three nights at this hotel and found that, while simple, it suited our needs. The rooms are a little small but that's not unusual for Europe and, more importantly, very clean. We were very pleased with the breakfast offered: a good variety of breads, meat, cheeses, cereals and yogurt. The close proximity to the Alexanderplatz station made reaching any area of the city we wished to visit easy. The only weakness that we found was that the walls are thin so you can hear your neighbors at times. I wouldn't be opposed to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: cooljools1931
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Ibis Mitte Berlin from 10 - 13 March 08 and could not find fault with this hotel. We took advantage of the IBIS "Happy 30" deal and got 3 nights for 149 Euros - which was an excellent bargain. The Hotel is in a very location, a mere 5-7 min walk to the Radio Tower & Alexanderplaz station. The Hotel rooms are basic standard but bright and clean. The bathroom was lovely and had a great shower. I can't understand why previous reviews have not been satified with the room because I believe that the room more than met my needs. In fact I think that the hotel offers excellent value for money and I was able to put more money into other aspects of my trip rather than focus too much on a luxurious room which I didn't spend a lot of time in. IWe had a TV in our room and a hairdryer was also provided in the bathroom. Our room was on the top floor (7th floor) and we had a fantastic view. We had breakfast on our last day in the hotel at a cost of 9.5 euros and it was very good indeed. The hotel also has free internet access in the reception area. All the staff that we spoke to were very friendly. Berlin is a lovely city and I would recommend it to anyone for a lovely city break. We also visited Berlin Zoo as well as visiting Brandenburg Gate, The remaining parts of the wall and Checkpoint Charlie. We went on the opentop bus (15 euros per person - hop on hop off) which left from the Ratthaus (Town hall) which is located near Alexanderplatz station. Well worth doing as it stops at all the famous landmarks/interesting locations in Berlin. Public Transport was sadly on strike when we were there so we didn't get a chance to travel on the trams, or metro -- but this did not hamper our enjoyment of a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Really not great”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea_me
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Ibis Mitte for 3 nights in July 07. We previously lived in Berlin and so know the city really well. As we lived in Prenzlauer Berg and our friends and fiance's sister live there, it seemed like it would be a decent base for our long weekend. We were planning on being out most of the time so were just looking for somewhere clean and convenient to sleep in east Berlin. The hotel was not good. The rooms are really small which wasn't really a problem for our 3 night stay but they are very dated. The bathroom is also tiny and dated and the whole place looks like it could do with some modernisation. It is a very basic hotel which I would expect from Ibis but it just doesn't have a nice feel and what makes this hotel worse is the staff. Staff at reception were unfriendly and quite rude. My fiance is German and I speak fluent German so we had no communication problems however we really had the impression that the staff at reception just couldn't be bothered. Check-in was ok but nothing special. On our 2nd night we went to ask something at the reception before going out for dinner. I had sprayed some perfume before we left the room (quite a normal thing to do I think) and whilst we were waiting at reception a woman working there started complaining loudly about my perfume to her colleague beside her was serving us! Not a problem if she doesn't like my perfume but how odd to start complaining about it in front of me! I went down to reception to ask for a hairdryer on another occasion and had interrupt the 2 receptionists from their personal conversation so that they could attend to me (my pet peeve), not only that but I then had to leave a €10 deposit for the hairdryer... Overall the hotel is not good and the staff there aren't making it any better. Location is handy for Mitte/east Berlin but I certainly won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost!”
Reviews.Author: gpissio
Reviews.Content: Maybe the worst hotel in the Europe. Small room,heating was out of order ( outside temp. was 2 C ), needless to mention that there was no hairdryer, for a room that costs 105 Eur o. Thank God it was clean. Breakfast was also a disappointment .

Reviews.Title: “Alles Gutte”
Reviews.Author: JOHN PL
Reviews.Content: Great location to use superb city transport network for access to historical / tourist attractions; easy to get to /from schonfeld airport, close to Hackescher Mark for night time fun , Prenzlauer Berg too( by tram ) . Really helpful friendly staff , clean warm room , good shower , typical IBIS comfortable functional room . Buffet breakfast like everything else really good value .

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jenjer97
Reviews.Content: I have been to many hotels in Europe and this one was the worst! Thier description was very misleading, the staff was not very friendly nor helpfull. They gave us wrong information RE: the subway which ended up costing me 80 EUR. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The room and hotel was dirty and the breakfast was not worth the 9.50 EUR.

Reviews.Title: “No walking Required!”
Reviews.Author: scotttheporg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ibis Mitte twice - once in 2003 and again in April 2007 and found it very easy to book, find and get to. The Ibis hotels website was easy to use and provided maps of the hotel's location. Used in conjunction with a Berlin transport map, getting there from Schonefeld was easy beyond words - only one change of train needed. The hotel has a tram stop right outside and the U-Bahn station at Rosa-Luxembourg Platz was within easy walking distance (if I'm truthful - the tram route passes the U-Bahn station, so there's no need to walk!) This means you can easily link to U and S-bahn by using the tram. The hotel was clean and well worth the price charged. Staff were friendly and very helpful, especially when dealing with my pitiful attempts at German! They all wear name badges with flags that identify which languages they speak. The bar was well run and served Berliner and Warsteiner (available in most German Ibis hotels) beers. Snacks were easy to arrange and tasty. The room was basic but was ideal for use as a base for seeing Berlin. Take a trip to the top floor at night for a brilliant view of the radio tower at Alexanderplatz. I would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting the city. I've stayed in many others in the city and haven't found anywhere else with such good and easy to reach transport links.

Reviews.Title: “Just the Job”
Reviews.Author: Bristolcitytillidie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lad's weekend in Berlin where we spent two nights at the Ibis. Although booked well in advance we were able to get a shared double room for 81 euros a night. Staff were very friendly, rooms clean, showers good and powerful, close to Alexanderplatz which is a good start point for the day and night. Not sure if they actually take stag weekend block bookings as the 14 of us booked separately, but they were tolerant of high spirits in the bar area as long as there was no larking around elsewhere - which was clear, understood and a good time was had by all. A good base to discuss some of the truly bizarre things this town has to offer - especially when you happen upon the Christopher Street demo by chance

Reviews.Title: “A So So hotel out of the way”
Reviews.Author: rootuid
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cheap and cheerful. There is a tram outside and a subway stop about 10mins away. The hotel is pretty basic and there isn't much to do around the area. It may be in Prenzlauer Berg but it's about 1.5km to the Prenzlauer Berg scene.

Reviews.Title: “Central, nice staff, good Price”
Reviews.Author: Ralf-Sommer
Reviews.Content: We have been there for 2 nights. Very friendly an young stuff, good breakfast, clean room, very central situated next to Alexanderplatz. Good location to explore Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: mrmaps
Reviews.Content: Like the title says, a really good value for your money. Very clean, quite professional staff. Not really in Mitte, but Mitte starts 100 meters south. Internet service was buggy. You had to buy 12 hour vouchers for 8 euros. It was a faulty system, and when it failed (killing connections before 12 hours were up, and on one occasion failing within 20 minutes) I could not get a refund. Otherwise, a great place. I doubt I could have stayed anywhere else as nice for the money.

Reviews.Title: “just what we needed in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: jon160
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibis Mitte Hotel in Berlin for 7 nights in March 2006. Spotlessly clean, quiet and very convenient. We used the superette at the gas station next door for snacks...which I had not read about beforehand. The trolley is just outside the door, and the underground subway is 2 blocks away...as is a full grocery store. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No problems at all”
Reviews.Author: yellowvegetable
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights in December 2004. We also took advantage of the 49 euro deal and it was great value for money considering that it is not much more than a private hostel room. Our double room on the 6th floor was spacious and clean. As you walk in there is a hanging rack and shelving unit, and then there is another door opening into the bedroom. This was useful in keeping out the sound of other guests walking along the corridoor. The bathroom was standard size, very clean, though it could have done with a better fan to get rid of the steam. There is a bar behind the reception desk, and though we didn't have a drink there, the prices were cheap and they also serve snacks like soups and nachos. The people at reception were very friendly and helpful, and kept the free apples and sweets at the front desk well stocked. We passed on the 9 euro breakfast and bought heated rolls and fruit from the petrol station next door - there are small tables where you can eat standing up, italian style. The location is not exactly smack bang in the centre of things, but the 10 min walk to Alexander Platz was nothing to complain about. Although the area doesn't look particularly appealing, we felt very safe walking around the area late at night. Berlin Mitte was a great area, lots of cosy little restaurants and shops which was about a 20 minute walk away. There are also many little bars to explore in the area north of the hotel. Though this hotel lacks charm and will not add to your 'german' experience, it is a very good option for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PaolaMariel
Reviews.Content: Very unfriendly staff, not willing to help tourist Locatin ok, but a 10' walk to tube station, not very convenient

Reviews.Title: “Best deal - fine place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and me stayed for two nights at Hotel Ibis Berlin Mitte at Jan 2005 end enjoying much our stay there. The hotel is modern, well equiped in a very good location for transports (The Tegel TXL bus just behind the corner). Nice and helping staff. Room with all you need - (extra soft towels etc.) - hair dryer at the reception. (There you can get an apple or candy even...) Wev'e got a special bargain price of 49 Euro - worth every cent! Recomended!! Nothing to do about the view of the factory nearby and the Alexander Platz - but you can overlook it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibis Mitte for 3 nights at the start of December 2003. The hotel is in a good location, just 5 minutes walk from the Alexander Platz U-bahn, and you can easily walk all the way down to the Brandenburg gate from the hotel in a morning too. The staff were really friendly, the room was very clean, the hotel was clean and welcoming and the price very good. A really good place to stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Ibis Berlin Mitte
HotelInfo.Address: Prenzlauer Allee 4, 10405 Berlin, Germany
